description:
Salvia splendens, commonly known as scarlet sage or tropical sage, is a species of flowering plant in the mint family Lamiaceae. It is native to Brazil and has been widely cultivated as an ornamental plant around the world.

Salvia splendens is an herbaceous perennial that grows up to 90 cm (35 inches) tall. It has bright red, showy flowers that are arranged in terminal spikes or panicles. The flowers are tubular in shape and attract hummingbirds and other nectar-feeding pollinators. The leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture.

The plant prefers well-drained, moist soil and thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions. It is commonly used in landscaping, bedding displays, and as a container plant. Salvia splendens is known for its long blooming period, often flowering from late spring to the first frost.

Phytochemically, the plant contains various secondary metabolites, including diterpenes, flavonoids, and essential oils, which contribute to its aromatic properties and potential medicinal applications. Overall, Salvia splendens is a vibrant and eye-catching ornamental species that has been widely cultivated for its attractive floral display.
